title: 105_s596
content: The Act titled "Juvenile Corrections Act of 1997" grants facilities for violent and serious chronic juvenile offenders. The "Juvenile Corrections Act of 1997" defines key terms such as Administrator, combination, juvenile delinquency program, qualifying State, secure detention facility, and secure correctional facility. The "Juvenile Corrections Act of 1997" defines key terms such as Administrator, combination, juvenile delinquency program, qualifying State, secure detention facility, and secure correctional facility. The Act authorizes grants to States and units of local government for planning, establishing, and operating secure detention facilities, secure correctional facilities, and programs for violent juveniles and serious chronic juvenile offenders. The "Juvenile Corrections Act of 1997" authorizes grants for programs and facilities for violent juveniles and serious chronic juvenile offenders. Applications must include assurances for educational, vocational training, and substance abuse treatment. The "Juvenile Corrections Act of 1997" authorizes grants for programs and facilities for violent juveniles and serious chronic juvenile offenders. Each facility or program funded with a grant under this section must provide intensive post-release supervision and services. The total amount made available under this section in any fiscal year is allocated to qualifying States and territories. Each facility or program funded with a grant under this section must undergo performance evaluation. Each grant under this section must include an evaluation component with outcome measures to determine program effectiveness in reducing recidivism. The Administrator reviews recipient performance and may require reports to be submitted. The Office of Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention requires recipients to submit evaluation results and necessary data. The Administrator provides technical assistance and training to grant recipients. Authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 1998-2000 is specified. The Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994 is amended to specify authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 1998-2000. Additionally, a report on accountability and performance measures in juvenile corrections programs is required. The Administrator must submit a report to Congress within 6 months of the Act's enactment, in consultation with relevant organizations, on using performance-based criteria to evaluate juvenile delinquency programs. The report will analyze various performance measures, including recidivism rates, and assess the feasibility of tying Federal funding for juvenile corrections to meeting performance criteria. The report will assess the feasibility of using performance-based criteria to evaluate juvenile delinquency programs and the potential for tying Federal funding to performance. It will also examine the national data collection for performance-based criteria and the cost of establishing uniform data standards for evaluating correctional facilities and programs. The report will evaluate juvenile delinquency programs and the administration of funds for Federal programs, including detention facilities.
